website_summaries.verdict: The Epson WorkForce 310 is a cost-efficient all-in-one printer that gives you five separate ink cartridges with an automatic document feeder and a detailed control panel. Combine those features with its lightning-fast print speeds, and the WorkForce 310 is a worthwhile addition to your office arsenal.

customer_reviews.title: Epson, Never Again
customer_reviews.text: Worked fine using it about 1-2 a month for 3 years. Recently it told me I needed to replace the ink, so I did. I went out bought 5 ink cartridges and changed. Them as it restarts the printer tells me that I am not using Epson ink cartridges even though I am and will not allow me to use the printer. So I removed them and then tried again over and over with no success. I threw the printer into my pool and now I am back on Amazon looking for a printer. Looks like it's going to be Brother this time. Never Again Epson.
customer_reviews.author: Geoff

customer_reviews.title: All Ink Cartridges must be full to use. RIDICULOUS DON'T BUY
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy this printer. It's fine until you have one black ink cartridge empty (there are 2 black cartridges) and the printer shuts down totally because it has to have all cartridges full before it will function. So ridiculously stupid. With my old printer I could print something in blue if that's the only cartridge full, but no not on the workforce. I am so angry and have to wait to buy one black cartridge with 4 FULL CARTRIDGES presently - including a full black cartridge to be able print. STUPID!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: DON'T GO NEAR IT!
customer_reviews.text: Good Lord, what a piece of junk this thing is. Print quality is poor. Scan function keeps producing error messages. The thing won't accept clone cartridges. All the tech support is in Manila. Previous Epson lasted 5 years with heavy service. I've only had this one for a few months and I'm ready to pitch it out the window. Constantly needs "head cleaning" and "nozzle checks" and all sorts of resets. One star is over-rating this thing. "Workforce" should become an oxymoron when applied to this printer it's more like "Brokeforce".
customer_reviews.author: SA SUBROSA

customer_reviews.title: It works for me!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this printer because my old one was worn out(by me).This all-in-one is faster, and has double black cartridges, so the black goes further before it needs changed,or filled. I am a crafter, and I print a lot of patterns, and lessons. If this printer last as long as my old one, I will have no complaints. It is easy to use,although the paper tray is a little tight side to side, I am pleased so far. I have owned this machine for about a month, and use it just about daily.
customer_reviews.author: elaine

customer_reviews.title: Excellent printer if you're not using a Mac
customer_reviews.text: The setup with the laptops in the house, was a snap. I mean effortless. The mac is a whole other issue. Multiple downloads and setting changes and no luck. Hard to be upset though, the rest of the household is thrilled. This is a very nice printer and at this price it's a steal. So, if you looking to use this with your Mac, I'd keep looking. If it's for your PC, you've found your printer.
customer_reviews.author: Sleddogroyal

customer_reviews.title: Espon good for the price  but not exceptional
customer_reviews.text: I had purchased this because I needed a good basic printer with all the functions. I have a Mac and my hp printer didn't work great after the upgrade to Snow Leopard. I downgraded from a 300 dollar printer to a 60 dollar printer. Overall not bad. I have a few frustrations with some things printing severly slow and sometimes it prints fine. The menu is a little frustrating as it doesnt seem to always do what i am asking...it likes to keep asking questions back. I would say a good basic printer. I did not purchase an HP because the c6180 i had was always calibrating or something to make noises constantly.
customer_reviews.author: C. S. May

customer_reviews.title: Its ok
customer_reviews.text: it is a good value for the price. I have a few issues but I am assuming it is my PC setup. Also, the way it feeds paper is some what sloppy. If the paper is at all not level it will still print and print at an angle. Other than that, it is great, scans well, prints nice, and is easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: M. Silva

customer_reviews.title: ... the letter so purchase an HP wireless and I loved it:
customer_reviews.text: I purchase three of these printers one of them started having problems right after I replace the ink it was printing half of the letter so purchase an HP wireless and I loved it :
customer_reviews.author: Mikey

customer_reviews.title: Does the job right.
customer_reviews.text: Works fine. Easy ordering and delivery. Love the results, don't like the expensive ink cartridge replacements.
customer_reviews.author: Rappingranny

customer_reviews.title: Workforce 31
customer_reviews.text: This printer is everything is said to be, the copies are easy so is the faxing, but it is noisey compared to my last Epson. I would still recommend this printer to anyone. I have windows vista and set up was very easy.
customer_reviews.author: Rose Varndell

customer_reviews.title: Great low-volume all-in-one
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Fast, inexpensive, individual inks, networked, quality feel, good print quality. New genuine Epson ink is relatively cheap (best value is 68 high capacity two-pack). Cons: Not an ink miser, but you can print draft/economy. Average ink usage. Loud startup/paper feed, but it has a "quiet" mode setting that helps some. Had it about a month now, no issues. Be sure to not overfill paper input tray. Too much paper = paperjam
customer_reviews.author: mjc

customer_reviews.title: decent machine, meet expectation.
customer_reviews.text: I got it all up, very fast, photo and b&w print are excellent. Only that, ink usage is also fast.
customer_reviews.author: P. Deng

customer_reviews.title: Epson 310
customer_reviews.text: Item is as advertised. Prints very well. Have not yet had occasion to use fax or copying functions. Expect they will work well also.
customer_reviews.author: Henry W. Cross

customer_reviews.title: Good Printer
customer_reviews.text: This Epson was bought to replace one that fell off the desk. After the fall the on/off button wouldn't work anymore. Since I liked the WorkForce 310 and had lots of extra ink, I decided to replace it. It copies and prints very fast. I don't use the fax so can't say anything about that. Shipping was very fast.
customer_reviews.author: Linda

customer_reviews.title: No Epson product ever again
customer_reviews.text: I had a critical need to scan a document, but could not because one of the two black ink cartridges was out of ink. Get that - I am not printing, just scanning, and the device was disabled. And, there was still a full black ink cartridge which the device refused to use. So, why even have two black ink cartridges? Bottom line, this device is nothing more than a vehicle for Epson to sell you overpriced ink. A very ugly corporate scam. Rather than be robbed by this company, I simply threw out my Workforce. I will never buy another device from this company.
customer_reviews.author: Phyzik

customer_reviews.title: This is a HORRIBLE way to treat customers
customer_reviews.text: See the others about the ink cartridges and when 1 runs out, it will not function...never will I buy from EPSON again--this is simply a means to force people to buy EPSON ink when it is not needed. This is a HORRIBLE way to treat customers....my response and I hope our will be to NEVER buy from EPSON again..will send a nice message to business analyst who think treating customers like this is acceptable--it is't--buy a printer from a different company...period!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: It simply stopped working for no reason
customer_reviews.text: It is a great printer for the price. Although now they increased the price dramatically. The scanner is amazing (scans in high resolution). Ink is cheap if you buy it through Amazon. However, after a few years, it stopped working for no reason. I printed one page, then the next page was blank. It did not print at all. All pages that were printed were black or with little ink. I replaced the ink and still had the same problem. I reset all the settings to default, did a nozzle check and head cleaning. Nothing seemed to work. Very disappointed with what happened. I don't think I would be buying any Epson products ever again.
customer_reviews.author: eben

customer_reviews.title: Empty ink cartridges stop ALL printing functions...
customer_reviews.text: This Epson's not what I thought it would be after all. Whenever only "one" ink cartridge runs out, it stops printing all together, which is stupid. At least it could give me the option of printing in plain b&w, but it doesn't. It just shuts down ALL printing functions from ONE cartridge. So for instance, right now the Magenta cartridge is empty. Well, ya don't need Magenta to print in black only, right? So what's the deal? Nope, can't default it over to just black. Stupid, stupid, stupid.
customer_reviews.author: Karen S Musselman

customer_reviews.title: Get what you pay for printer
customer_reviews.text: The print quality was average and had banding when not printed in the highest quality mode. And even then, at times, gradients could be seen. Epson, renowned for its great photo print quality, failed with the 310. Not only did it fail in quality, it failed on me near the one year mark--the device goes through all the motions, but no printing, copying, etc. Another negative is when one, of the two, ink cartridges failed, then the printer would not allow printing until it was replaced. Even if the other was new... I got what I paid for...
customer_reviews.author: Martin S

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for about 5 minutes.
customer_reviews.text: Pretty much all the negative reviews mention the same flaws we saw: it sucks down ink, when one cartridge out f the 5 is empty it fails to print at all, and there's no way to make it print using the black ink - it uses all the color ones instead. I'd also like to note that the user interface sucks. It's clunky and driver support is terrible.
customer_reviews.author: A. Trotter

customer_reviews.title: Not good
customer_reviews.text: Not sure why I originally bought this unit, but I do know why I'm shopping for another one. - Scanner has trouble feeding documents that are folded. This means any statement you receive in the mail is not going to feed correctly unless you watch it. - Print quality is good when ink is new and full, but will unexpected go to crap. I can't figure out a pattern to it. Not sure if is low ink issue, or plugged print head, but I'm done fighting it. - Network connectivity is sketchy. Not sure if this is an issue with my network, or this printer, it isn't playing well with other IP addresses.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Sperry

customer_reviews.title: Awful
customer_reviews.text: Will never buy another EPSON product again. The fact that this was released to the public is a disgrace. It will cost you literally hundreds of dollars to maintain if you print... and I'm not talking a lot. The cartridges need to be charged, the software requires constant head-cleaning and alignment. It carries 2 black cartridges, if one is out, you can't print until its replace (no option to use the colors as the black). Worst product I've ever spent money on.... seriously.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Could have done better
customer_reviews.text: Paper feeder for copy function jams frequently. The feeder on my machine died after less than a year. I can still copy, slowly, using the faceplate. Biggest complaint---it takes five cartridges, two black & three color, to work. And it is always running out of ink. The price of the machine is fine, but I've spent way more than that already on ink. I'll know better next time. Reminds me of the old Polaroid cameras which they practically gave away, then the cost of the film was about the price of the camera, every time you bought some.
customer_reviews.author: AthomeinFL

customer_reviews.title: Several Design Flaws
customer_reviews.text: Overall this unit is not bad for a cheap printer. However, the design flaws are as follows: Won't let you print in BW if a color cartridge is low. Will stop printing and make you change a cartridge when any cartridge is low even though it's still printing fine, therby wasting a bunch of ink. The unit works OK and is reasonably dependable but it will drive you crazy with how it handles the ink.
customer_reviews.author: KCW

customer_reviews.title: Great little machine
customer_reviews.text: Fresh off a horrific experience with a Lexmark 3500, the Epson Workforce 310 has been a delight so far. The wireless setup was easy, intuitive and quick. Within 20 minutes of opening the box, I was printing. Colors are vivid and accurate, and the print speed and sharp resolution are surprisingly good for a printer in this price range. The paper insertion tray seems a bit flimsy, so I would not be shocked if I encountered some structural problems later on. It's too early to express an opinion on ink efficiency, etc. Overall, I am very satisfied with the Epson Workforce 310 and highly recommend it for ordinary home use.
customer_reviews.author: JMBreland

customer_reviews.title: Flawed product
customer_reviews.text: Amazingly, I'm on my third unit, the other two were replaced for free for problems Epson could not fixed. If the printer were to work as advertised this would be an awesome unit, but unfortunately it has not. The problem I just noticed with this unit is that the printing of text goes into what appears to be italic. I don't print much, so it may not matter to me. I wish Epson would get to the bottom of the problem with this model.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: If you like replacing ink cartridges, this is the printer for you!
customer_reviews.text: Holy bejeezus! All I ever do is replace the ink cartridges. And it's not because I print a lot. This is the printer in my home office that I use only once in a while. I recommend NOT buying this product. Save your money and buy a laser.
customer_reviews.author: SD

customer_reviews.title: Does not work!!!
customer_reviews.text: The literature says this unit will still work as a scanner without ink, it does not. If you are considering this unit, look for something else. This is my first Epson, and my last!!!!
customer_reviews.author: SWS

customer_reviews.title: Pulls Paper Crooked
customer_reviews.text: The device works fine overall. The scanner works fine, the copier is fine, the fax is fine, but the printer pulls paper in crooked. Since most of what I do is print and I print on forms, the crooked printing REALLY shows up. If you don't mind having your printing at an angle then the printer is fine (other than it won't print at all when an ink cartridge runs out). If having straight print is important, I don't recommend this printer.
customer_reviews.author: B. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Do not purchase this piece of shit printer - It'll ...
customer_reviews.text: Do not purchase this piece of s*** printer - It'll work for MAYBE 2-5 months and out of no where stop working!
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointing
customer_reviews.text: I've owned this printer for a year. I do not print very often but still I've had to change all the ink cartridges twice. As soon as I change one cartridge another needs replacing. Also the automatic feeder does not work well so I have to feed it one page at a time when i need to copy or scan a document. I have been a supporter of Epson products for many years, this is my 3rd Epson printer and it is my last.
customer_reviews.author: EAS33309

customer_reviews.title: Epson 310 workforce
customer_reviews.text: Le produit en général va bien, pour quelqu'un qui ne l'utisile pas tous les jours. Le fax ne va pas bien plus que 2 mois, sauf si utilisé en mode page/page sans utilisé le tirroire du dessu. Le scanner n'est pas extra, mais elle imprime bien et fonctionne bien en wireless. C'est vraiment le fax qui me cause du stress....
customer_reviews.author: jonathan

customer_reviews.title: Good, but....
customer_reviews.text: The PRICE is good for the Epson 310 Workforce printer, but... 1. It's noisy when it "grabs" the paper from the feeder tray 2. Maybe most people wouldn't care, but it's hard to figure out how to shut it off. The pilot light stays on. I have to unplug it to save a few pennies of electricity. I have not hooked up the fax feature. It gives FAST text prints and is good on color photographs.
customer_reviews.author: Ted

customer_reviews.title: Pile of Wet Garbage
customer_reviews.text: This thing is a piece of wet garbage. It won't print anything even though I replaced the black ink. I've worked on copiers so I know I installed them correctly. Do yourself a favor and DO NOT buy Epson's products!
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Oak

customer_reviews.title: I want the Office Space guys to destroy it
customer_reviews.text: This is the worst printer. If it runs out of any ink, it won't print anything. I have been so frustrated by this printer multiple times. I never write reviews so the fact that I am writing one is indicative of how much I can't stand this printer. Ugh!!!!!!!!! Don't buy one.
customer_reviews.author: elb

customer_reviews.title: Worst I have ever seen.
customer_reviews.text: This without a doubt the worst printer I have ever owned. The first one lasted 8 months before it quit feeding paper. It was replaced under warranty ( an agonizing process in itself). The next one lasted less than 90 days before it jammed up so bad it pulled 2 of the ribbon cables loose inside the printer. I trashed it and bought a Brother printer.
customer_reviews.author: willobi

customer_reviews.title: absolute worst printer ever
customer_reviews.text: absolute worst printer ever. every time I try to print something it is a new issue. Heads clogged, ink out (stopping all functions), feeding roll mis aligned. DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY,
customer_reviews.author: zzact7

customer_reviews.title: Worst printer ever
customer_reviews.text: The worst printer ever bought have had nothing but trouble from it was bought would never advise anyone to buy
customer_reviews.author: frances quinn

customer_reviews.title: Worse Printer Ever
customer_reviews.text: Worse printer I ever had. After buying 3 sets of ink it prints only blue color. Never buy Epson printer, ever if you need it more than one month.
customer_reviews.author: Tesla

customer_reviews.title: Do Not Buy This Printer!
customer_reviews.text: This is the worst printer I have ever owned. The black ink requires that you have two separate cartridges installed or it will not print. Each cartridge lasts for a very few print jobs, and they are expensive. The cartridges themselves are also often defective. I will never buy an Epson printer again... it is a complete waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Claire Menck

customer_reviews.title: best printer for the price
customer_reviews.text: works well, easy to set up, printer works fast and is clear and faxes are clear. I have not had any trouble with it.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia A. Oballe

customer_reviews.title: Epson 310 Workforce
customer_reviews.text: There are two ways to use this machine. Ethernet or USB. Setting up the Ethernet was alot tougher than the USB, yet when I did get through all the programming, the unit works just fine.The cost was excellant, and was delivered in 3 days. Overall I feel I got a excellant deal.
customer_reviews.author: David L. Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Dissapointing
customer_reviews.text: Looks great! Very sleek design, and matches my black computer. However many drawbacks including: - Does NOT do double-sided on its own. This is really disappointing. Printers half this price usually have that capability. Misses out on a great way to save paper. - VERY loud start-up noise - Does not print that quickly Wouldn't recommend getting this. Definitely look at other brands
customer_reviews.author: Melanie Myers

product_meta.title: Epson WorkForce 310 Color Inkjet All-in-One Printer (C11CA49201)
product_meta.description:
The WorkForce 310 delivers laser quality documents and vibrant color output -- fast! In fact, it prints laser quality documents up to 2x faster than leading competitive ink jet printers. With built-in Ethernet networking, this amazing all-in-one makes it easy for your entire workgroup to share one product for all their business needs, whether it's to print, copy, scan or fax. With a 30-page Auto Document Feeder plus maximum print speeds of 36 ppm black/20 ppm color, and laser quality print speeds of 16 ppm, black/5.5 ppm color, the WorkForce 310 allows you to do even more in record time. And, it uses up to 70 percent less energy than a laser printer when printing daily jobs. Smudge, fade and water resistant prints mean you can print everyday documents for immediate handling. And, laser quality output ensures results that will leave a lasting impression.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
Fast, reliable and cost-efficient - The WorkForce 310 delivers laser quality documents and vibrant color output – fast! In fact, it’s the world’s fastest all-in-one in its class!1 With built-in Ethernet networking, this amazing all-in-one makes it easy for your entire workgroup to share one product for all their business needs, whether it's to print, copy, scan or fax. With a 30-page Auto Document Feeder, plus ISO print speeds of 16 ISO ppm, black/5.5 ISO ppm color†, the WorkForce 310 allows you to do even more in record time. And, it uses up to 70% less energy than a laser printer when printing daily jobs.2 Smudge, fade and water resistant prints mean you can print everyday documents for immediate handling. And, laser quality output ensures results that will leave a lasting impression. 






What the press is saying:

"The balance of features and price is enough to make the WorkForce 310 the Editors' Choice for budget light duty printing in a small or home office." David M. Stone, PC Mag.com (7.28.09) WorkForce 310 Named Winner of Roundup on Databazaar Blog
"The Review Roundup winner this week appears to be the Epson WorkForce 310, which earned an Editor's Choice from PC Magazine..." Staff, Databazaar Blog (8.7.09) 



Professional quality without compromise

Print proposals with crisp, sharp text and brochures with pro quality color. With WorkForce 310, you always get exceptional quality, without sacrificing speed. This powerful performer boasts ISO print speeds of 16 ISO ppm black/5.5 ISO ppm color†, which makes this all-in-one the world’s fastest in its class1


Built-in Ethernet with wireless networking capability

Use the built-in Ethernet to share your all-in-one among multiple computers. Or, connect to the Ethernet port of a wireless router for wireless printing and more3. (Computer, wireless router and Ethernet cable not included.)



Productivity for your busy pace

WorkForce 310 makes it easy to work more efficiently. Use the built-in, 30-page Auto Document Feeder to quickly copy, scan and fax stacks of documents. Fax important documents (in black-and-white or color) in as fast as 3 seconds per page or save up to 180 pages in memory. Store up to numbers with the convenient speed dial list. Or, program your five most frequently dialed numbers using the dedicated speed dial buttons on the control panel. With the included PC Fax, you can even send a fax right from your computer without having to print out the sheet and then fax it.4 It’s a great way to save time and paper! And, when you use WorkForce 310 to scan in a document, and you’re connected to a network, this innovative all-in-one allows you to specify which computer you’d like to send the file to.

EpsonCompetitor 
Protect important documents

While many competitive inks often take several minutes to dry, prints made with instant-dry DURABrite® Ultra Ink allow you to share documents and photos immediately after printing. Prints are smudge, fade and water resistant. And, they’re highlighter friendly too. Now, it’s easier than ever to protect important documents.


Smart ink system

Individual ink cartridges give you control over ink usage. Replace only the cartridge you need! There are even high-capacity cartridges available. And, with dual Black cartridges, you get about two times more prints.5 So, you can print more and change cartridges less often.

Best of all, with DURABrite Ultra Ink, only one set of cartridges is necessary to print top quality documents or photos. There’s no need to spend additional money on optional photo inks.


Save energy, save paper

Saving is easy with WorkForce 310 — you save money and paper. In fact, with manual, two-sided printing, you’ll save up to 50% of your paper supply.6 And, you’ll save energy too because WorkForce 310 uses up to 70% less power than a laser printer.2


Product protection you can count on

With WorkForce 310, you get phone support, without charge, for the life of the product.7 And, when you register your product, you can get access to an exclusive web site for business templates, “how-to” tutorials, and other useful resources, plus exclusive offers. WorkForce 310 comes with a 1-year limited warranty, which includes quick product exchange, so you can rest easy knowing you have dependable service and support.


BE MORE INFORMED
The new international ISO print speed standard Print speed is critically important when buying a printer or all-in-one. But how do you compare print speeds when different manufacturers measure in different ways? Now you can. Much like the "MPG" ratings on new cars, there's now a new industry standard for measuring print speed, which allows for an "apples-to-apples" comparison between different printer models and brands. The International Organization for Standardization (widely known as ISO) developed this industry approved and internationally accepted standard, specifically for ink jet printers and all-in-ones. It measures "out of the box" (default) print speeds using "real world" printing scenarios, so you can be sure you're getting a product that performs at the speed you need.


Features/Benefits

 * Save time — increase your productivity with the world’s fastest all-in-one1 in its class
 * Speed through critical documents — ISO print speeds of 16 ISO ppm black/5.5 ISO ppm color†
 * Easily share your printer with others — built-in Ethernet with wireless networking capability; connect to your wireless router using the Ethernet port and print wirelessly3
 * Get more done — 30-page Auto Document Feeder to quickly copy, scan or fax stacks of originals
 * PC fax — fax documents directly from your computer4
 * High-speed faxing in black and color — as fast as 3 sec per page; speed dial storage up to 60 numbers; fax memory up to 180 pages
 * Protect important documents — smudge, fade and water resistant prints; documents rival those from a laser printer; highlighter-friendly too
 * Save energy — uses up to 70% less power than a laser printer2
 * Save paper — save up to 50% of your paper supply with manual, two-sided printing6
 * Print twice as much — get about 2x more prints with two Black cartridges5
 * Individual ink cartridges — replace only the color you need
 * Product protection you can count on — 1-year limited warranty; phone support, without charge, for the life of the product7; plus, access to exclusive templates, tutorials and offers with product registration


Eco features

 * Uses up to 70% less power than a laser printer6
 * Save up to 50% of your paper supply with manual, two-sided printing5
 * ENERGY STAR® qualified
 * Designed to be Recycled8


Recommended Supplies 
Epson Ink Supplies 
69 DURABrite Ultra Black ink cartridge (T069120) 
69 DURABrite Ultra Cyan ink cartridge (T069220) 
69 DURABrite Ultra Magenta ink cartridge (T069320) 
69 DURABrite Ultra Yellow ink cartridge (T069420) 
69 DURABrite Ultra color multi-pack (3 colors) (T069520) 

Epson Paper Supplies 
Heavyweight 8.5 x 11 in, Matte Paper, 50 sheets (S041257) 
Photo Quality Inkjet Paper, 100 sheets (S041062) 
Premium Semi-Gloss Photo Paper 8.5 x 11 in, 20 sheets (S041331) 
Premium Glossy Photo Paper 4 x 6 in, 100 sheets (S041727) 



What’s in the Box

 * WorkForce 310 all-in-one
 * Instruction manual
 * CD-ROM with drivers and bonus software
 * Power cord
 * Telephone cord
 * 5 DURABrite Ultra Ink cartridges; two 69 Standard-capacity Black ink cartridges and three 69 standard-capacity color ink cartridges: Cyan, Magenta, Yellow


WorkForce products
Engineered for business.

Show the world what your business is made of with WorkForce, Epson’s exclusive line of printers and all-in-ones that are engineered for better business productivity. Get laser quality output at laser fast speeds from a product you can rely on.





† ISO ppm is based on the new international standard for measuring print speed. Black and color print speeds are determined in default, single-sided mode in accordance with ISO/ICE 24734.

 1. Fastest in its class; 50% faster than the competition printing black text in default, single-sided mode, in accordance with ISO/ICE 24734. Compared to ink jet all-in-ones priced at $199 or less, as of September 2009, based on independent testing.
 2. Compared to the best selling monochrome and color multifunction laser printers available for $499 or less as of January 1, 2009. Actual power savings will vary by product model and usage.
 3. Ethernet connectivity built in. Wireless printing requires an Ethernet cable (CAT 5) and a wireless router set to DHCP. Performance may vary.
 4. For sending faxes on Windows® only.
 5. Two Black cartridges allow about twice as much black printing as compared to printing with a single Black cartridge.
 6. Some applications and/or functions, like two-sided printing, may not be supported by Mac®.
 7. Epson provides phone support without charge for the life of the product. Telephone toll charges may apply.
 8. See our website for convenient and reasonable recycling options at www.epson.com/recycle.
feature_bullets: Save time- laser quality documents at up to 2x the speed of leading competitive ink jet printers
Speed through critical documents- maximum speed of 36 ppm black/20 ppm color; laser quality speeds of 16 ppm black/5.5 ppm color
Built-in Ethernet with wireless networking capability; connect to your wireless router using the Ethernet port and print wirelessly
Get more done - 30-page Auto Document Feeder to quickly copy, scan or fax stacks of originals
High-speed faxing in black and color - as fast as 3 sec per page; speed dial storage up to 60 numbers; fax memory up to 180 pages

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.0 out of 5 stars67 ratings3.0 out of 5 stars
